Package org.thewhitemage13.repository

Interface PostRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Post,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Post,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Post,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Post,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Post,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Post>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Post,Long>
public interface PostRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Post,Long>
Repository interface for managing Post entities.

This interface extends JpaRepository, providing methods for CRUD operations and custom queries on Post entities. It includes methods for querying posts by user ID, checking the existence of posts, counting posts by user ID, and deleting posts associated with a user.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Method Details

    • findAllByUserId

      Optional<List<Post>> findAllByUserId(Long userId)
      Finds all posts associated with a specific user ID.

      This method retrieves a list of Post entities that are associated with a given user, identified by their userId.

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose posts are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a list of posts for the user, or an empty Optional if no posts are found

    • existsById

      boolean existsById(Long postId)
      Checks if a post exists by its ID.

      This method checks if a post with the given postId exists in the database.

      Specified by:
      existsById in interface org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Post,Long>
      Parameters:
      postId - the ID of the post to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the post exists, false otherwise

    • countByUserId

      Integer countByUserId(Long userId)
      Counts the number of posts created by a specific user.

      This method returns the number of posts associated with a given user, identified by their userId.

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose posts are to be counted
      Returns:
      the number of posts created by the user

    • deleteAllByUserId

      void deleteAllByUserId(Long userId)
      Deletes all posts associated with a specific user.

      This method removes all Post entities from the database that are associated with a given user, identified by their userId.

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose posts are to be deleted
